channel.title: iTouch emulator
channel.description:
I'm looking for an emulator that emulates the iTouch or iPhone.
I googled some but all I found was emulators FOR the iTouch, as in play the SNES on it.
Basically there's some games for it my little brother has on his and I don't have one, but I always have a computer near me and a flash drive and I'd like to play them.

item.title: iTouch emulator
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:24, topic:268119”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=353899.msg2717365#msg2717365 date=1237732459]

Just found something that looks really promising.
http://merhl.com/?page_id=75

thats good but it wont let me speak into it the mic doesnt work properly
EDIT: i’ve fixed it and it works good free aswell
[/quote]

It works but it oviously isnt the real Iphone OS and 70% of the functions are disabled.[/quote]
True, but it’s a nice find I’m always using it

Read full topic

thats good but it wont let me speak into it the mic doesnt work properly

item.title: iTouch emulator
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

N00b1:

i think (don’t hol;d me to it) you can actually download the SDK for building ihone/itouch apps and the EMU they have in the SDK will run compiled apps

Been there, done that, I don’t have a Mac and I’m not getting an emulator for a Mac for an iTouch emulator.

charliebruce:

The SDK is the only way I can think of - there’s no “magic” iTouch emulator, it doesn’t exist. There’s no point in doing it anyway, your PC can do anything the iPod can do. iPod touch games are invariably wastes of time anyway, and why would anyone apart from Apple need an iPod touch emulator? For the SDK you need the source code though.

Nothing is magic. I never asked for anything “magic.” What the fuck were you even trying to say? What’s the point in any other emulator?

Simply put, there’s a game on there that is better than any computer counterpart I’ve ever played.

Read full topic

The SDK is the only way I can think of - there’s no “magic” iTouch emulator, it doesn’t exist. There’s no point in doing it anyway, your PC can do anything the iPod can do. iPod touch games are invariably wastes of time anyway, and why would anyone apart from Apple need an iPod touch emulator? For the SDK you need the source code though.

item.title: iTouch emulator
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:6, topic:268119”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=353899.msg2711878#msg2711878 date=1237360108]
it will be difficult to get one for the itouch because it has a touch screen the hardware compatibility issue is probably the reason there aren’t many, if at all any
[/quote]
Your Finger= Mouse.
With the new jail-break someone must at least have copied the OS to a pc.

A little off topic but iEmulator (VM Software on Mac OSX) will be ported onto Ipod Touch and Iphone. Plus, the Touch has a 533Mhz processor and 128mb of Ram so you could even emulate XP.[/quote]
waht about when you have to use multiple fingers at the same time?

Read full topic

item.title: iTouch emulator
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

2nd generation: ARM11 533 MHz
ARMv6KZ to be precise.

It seems that the Motorola RIZR Z8 uses the exact same architecture as the Ipod Touch and Iphone.

Read full topic

sanga282:

it will be difficult to get one for the itouch because it has a touch screen the hardware compatibility issue is probably the reason there aren’t many, if at all any

Your Finger= Mouse.
With the new jail-break someone must at least have copied the OS to a pc.

A little off topic but iEmulator (VM Software on Mac OSX) will be ported onto Ipod Touch and Iphone. Plus, the Touch has a 533Mhz processor and 128mb of Ram so you could even emulate XP.
